gurmukhi: ਸਬਦ ਸੁਰਤਿ ਲਿਵ ਗੁਰ ਸਿਖ ਸੰਧਿ ਮਿਲੇ ਅਾਤਮ ਅਵੇਸ ਪ੍ਰਮਾਤਮ ਪ੍ਰਬੀਨ ਹੈ
transliteration: Sabad Surati Liv Gur Sikh Sandhi Milay , Aatam Avays Pramaatam Prabeen Hai ?
translation: With the union of a disciple coming in the refuge of True Guru and when his mind is engrossed in the divine word, he becomes an adept in uniting his self with the Supreme soul.

gurmukhi: ਤਤੈ ਮਿਲਿ ਤਤ ਸ੍ਵਾਂਤ ਬੂੰਦ ਮੁਕਤਾਹਲ ਹੁੲਿ ਪਾਰਸ ਕੈ ਪਾਰਸ ਪਰਸਪਰ ਕੀਨ ਹੈ
transliteration: Tatai Mili Tat Svaant Boond Moukataahal Hui , Paaras Kai Paaras Parasapar Keen Hai ?
translation: As the mythical rain-drop (Swati) turns into a pearl when it falls on an Oyster shell and becomes highly valuable, so would a person become when his heart is filled with the elixir-like Naam of the Lord. Uniting with Supreme, he too becomes like Him. Like

gurmukhi: ਜੋਤ ਮਿਲਿ ਜੋਤਿ ਜੈਸੇ ਦੀਪਕੈ ਦਿਪਤ ਦੀਪ ਹੀਰੈ ਹੀਰਾ ਬੇਧੀਅਤ ਅਾਪੈ ਅਾਪਾ ਚੀਨ ਹੈ
transliteration: Jot Mili Joti Jaisay Deepakai Dipat Deepa , Heerai Heeraa Baydheeat Aapai Aapaa Cheen Hai ?
translation: As an oil lamp lights the other, so does a true devotee (Gursikh) meeting with True Guru becomes an embodiment of His light and shines in the diamond like a diamond. He reckons his self then.

gurmukhi: ਚੰਦਨ ਬਨਾਸਪਤੀ ਬਾਸਨਾ ਸੁਬਾਸ ਗਤਿ ਚਤਰ ਬਰਨ ਜਨ ਕੁਲ ਅਕੁਲੀਨ ਹੈ ॥੨੨੫॥
transliteration: Chandan Banaasapatee Baasanaa Soubaas Gati , Chatar Baran Jan Kul Akuleen Hai ?225?
translation: All the vegetation around a sandalwood tree becomes fragrant. Similarly the people of all the four castes become of higher caste after meeting with True Guru. (225)
